dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Hello~?

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: I'm talking to you, Heathcliff.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: ...What.
It's a bright, sunny day in the City.
The child sat on a bench, wearing a pair of pitch black sunglasses.
Next to her was another child, totally confident that he didn't look suspicious in the slightest.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Do you seriously think you don't look suspicious with the way you're acting?

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: ...Long as you don't keep bugging me with the prattle. What, there a problem?

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Yeah, I've got a problem. Who reads both pages of a newspaper like that in this day and age?

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: ...Ugh.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: If you're going to do that, at least stop peeking over the pages.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: You're going to scare our VIP away, 'kay?
The child sighed deeply, belittling her coworker.
The two children were conducting a covert mission. Specifically, it was 'appointed-persons protection', one of the Zwei's job categories.
It's a well-known fact that the Zwei Association specializes in client protection, but their exact methodology isn't so public.
Covert supervision was one of those methodologies: a service for people who want protection without interruption to their daily lives.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Haah... Won't something please happen? Just dawdling here is starting to get boring.
However, the child appears rather disgruntled.
Understandably so, as she was assigned an appointed-persons protection job only because of her proclivity to act naturally in unfamiliar circumstances...
Not because this was what she wanted to do per se.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Ugh... I should've picked a different job. But this looked so cool on paper...
...Perhaps the child wasn't entirely free of fault.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: …Hold on, he's on the move.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: What? He's supposed to faff around there for another hour or... oi!
The child next to her rose to his feet, crumpling the paper.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Woohoo~ Something's finally happening!

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Blimey, speak of the devil...
An excited child and a frustrated child...
The duo subtly strode up behind the VIP.
...Hey.
H-Hey?
You really don't get what's going down, do you?
Look, I'm threatening you right now, got it~?
W-What in the? I'm just here to meet someone for the contract payment...
Meet someone? More like greet my blade. Now, say hello!
A—Ahh...

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Alright, hold your horses!
A heavy thwack echoed through the narrow alley.
W—Who are?! Ah… The Zwei?

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Yep~ Haven't seen each other since we signed the contract, eh?
Where in the world were you...

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Listen, can you stick to the routine you told us before~?

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: It's not easy being stealthy around you when you veer off your usual course...

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Anyways! From this point on, the Zwei's here to protect you!

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Heath! Get this lout straight outta here~!
With that, the child stepped in front of the client with her characteristic defensive stance.

dataList.title: Zwei Section 5
dataList.content: Alright, who's up next? Come on out!
Grinning that there was finally something to do.
